section.title: Introduction
section.para: TBX is a C++ library to help write desktop programs for RISC OS. At its core level it interfaces with the RISC OS toolbox which provides objects to show windows/gadgets and standard dialogue boxes.
As well as this core level it provides other classes to help in the creation of fully featured applications.
It is released under the MIT licence that allows it to be used with open and closed source applications freely.

section.title: Requirements
section.para: TBX requires the GCC4.1 RISC OS compiler or later. To create/edit the toolbox resources you will need ResEdit or CCRes.

The machine that builds a tbx program will need long filename support. The final applications can be theoretically run on a machine with RISC OS 3.1 onwards though some features may not work in such a case, but is tested and developed using RISC OS 4 and 5.
